intro: Epacris robusta, commonly known as the robust epacris, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Heath family (Ericaceae) and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or heathland environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are adapted for pollination by birds and insects. Epacris robusta is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and hardy nature.
